# canStart

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether you can start the VM.

## Declaration

```swift
var canStart: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] when the VM is in a state that allows you to start it. Call the [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/start(completionHandler:)] method (Swift)  or [doc://com.apple.virtualization/documentation/Virtualization/VZVirtualMachine/start()] method (Objective-C) to start the VM.

## Getting the state of the VM

- **state**: The current execution state of the VM.
- **VZVirtualMachine.State**: The execution states of the VM.
- **graphicsDevices**: The list of configured graphics devices on the virtual machine.
- **canPause**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can pause the VM.
- **canResume**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can resume the VM.
- **canStop**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can stop the VM.
- **canRequestStop**: A Boolean value that indicates whether you can ask the guest operating system to stop running.
- **queue**: The queue associated with this virtual machine.
